rationale: Assessed as Vulnerable, due to its restricted Extent of Occurrence of 14,065 km². This is considered to be less than ten locations as a few threatening events would rapidly affect all the individuals in the population. A. octoactinotos is currently threatened by a continuing decline in habitat quality, largely due to an increase in water pollution in the Kinabatangan River basin.
assessor: Jenkins, A., Kullander, F.F. & Tan, H.H.
evaluator: Collen, B., Darwall, W., Ram, M. & Smith, K. (SRLI Freshwater Fish Evaluation Workshop)
